Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance, access patterns, and redundancy. Identify the applications and users that will utilize Azure Files.
Design the storage architecture, including file share structure, access permissions, and integration with existing systems.
Provision a new Azure Storage Account in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure the account is configured for redundancy and meets performance requirements.
Create and configure file shares within the Azure Storage Account. Define quotas, tiers, and access policies as per requirements.
Enable security features such as encryption at rest, Azure Active Directory (AAD) authentication, and access control lists (ACLs) for file shares.
Configure private endpoints or VPNs to ensure secure access to Azure Files from on-premises or other networks.
Verify access to file shares from intended clients and applications. Test permissions, performance, and connectivity.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Storage Analytics. Configure alerts for storage capacity, access errors, and performance metrics.
Document the storage account and file share configurations, access policies, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting Azure Files.
Set up backup policies and recovery procedures for Azure Files using Azure Backup or third-party tools.
Ensure the Azure Files setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Conduct regular audits to verify compliance and security postures.
